name: Hot Cauliflower Wings
author: Shannan Labrador
summary: Spicy and crispy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside. Serve these cauliflower wings with a vegan ranch or blue cheese dressing.
ingredients: 1 small head cauliflower, broken into small florets
salt and ground black pepper to taste
2 cups almond milk, or as needed
½ cup bread crumbs, or as needed  (Optional)
2 ounces vegan margarine (such as Earth Balance®)
1 (8 ounce) bottle hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot®)
directions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper
Mix flour, paprika, salt, and pepper together
Add enough almond milk to create a slightly thick, soupy texture
Place bread crumbs in a shallow bowl
Dip cauliflower pieces one at a time into the batter, then roll in bread crumbs
Place on the prepared cookie sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until starting to brown, 15 to 20 minutes
While 'wings' are baking, melt margarine and whisk together with hot sauce
Reduce oven temperature to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Dip 'wings' into the sauce and place back on the cookie sheet; continue baking for 10 to 15 minutes
